DOC.brief_summary: A prospective study of 700 patients with coronary artery disease will undergo non invasive evaluation of their carotid arteries by ultrasound and microwave radiometry. The patients will be followed up for 3 years and their outcome regarding the cardiovascular events (death, cardiac events, cerebrovascular events) will be recorded
DOC.detailed_description: Carotid artery Thermal heterogeneity recorded by MR will be corelated to cardiovascular events (death, cardiac events, cerebrovascular events) as well as to all demographic (age, sex, hypertension, dyslipidemia, smoking status, etc) factors
DOC.criteria: Consecutive patients with coronary artery disease admitted in our hospital Patients with history of previous cerebrovascular event, History of vasculitis, intermittent inflammatory, infectious, or neoplastic conditions likely to be associated with an acutephase response.
